summary:
Objectives :
* Stretch the limits of Science and of my own knowledge. 
* Use Chemistry for innovation at the interface with biology and/or material sciences.
* Expand my expertise to other disciplines and techniques.

Specialisations : Organic synthesis, Carbohydrates, Iminosugars, Click Chemistry, Multivalent Systems, radiochemistry (F-18), radiotracers, polymers, materials, crosslinkers.

awards.title: MITACS Accelerate Fellowship
awards.description: I was awarded a MITACS Accelerate postdoctoral fellowship to conduct research on universal crosslinkers, along with my co-workers C. Simhadri and L. Bi. MITACS is a Canadian not-for-profit organization that has been supporting industrial and social innovation in Canada designing and delivering research and training programs in Canada for over 20  years.  This  fellowship  encourages  partnerships  with  the  industry,  allowing  me  to  work  part-time  in  applied research for Epic Ventures, Inc. who provided more than half of the funding.

awards.title: Bourse doctorale du Ministère de l'Enseignement Supérieur et de la Recherche (MESR)
awards.description: As I was completing both my Diplôme d’Ingénieur and my MSc in Molecular & Supramolecular Chemistry with an research internship overseas, I was granted a 3-year studentship from the Ministry of Higher Education and Research (MESR in French), allowing me to pursue a PhD on the topic and in the laboratory of my choice at the Université de Strasbourg. The attribution of this highly competitive studentships was based on grades obtained during the MSc and an interview by a 10-strong pool of professors.
awards.issuer: Université de Strasbourg / Ministère de l'Enseignement Supérieur et de la Recherche

profile_positions.description:
Doctoral Advisor: Pr Philippe Compain
Supervisor: Dr Anne Bodlenner

"Conception & synthesis of original iminosugars of biological interest: Click engineering for multivalent systems."

Main tasks:
* Developed a new methodology for the synthesis of glycosyl azides from 1,6-anhydrosugars.
* Synthesized new sugar and iminosugar Click clusters by way of Click Chemistry (CuAAC).
* Performed in vitro studies to evaluate inhibition potency of various multivalent systems.

Oral Communication:
* SECO 51 (Semaine d'Etudes de Chimie Organique), Port-Leucate, May 2014 :
"Synthesis of cyclopeptoid-based iminosugar click clusters"
* JCO (Journées de Chimie Organique), Paris, September 2013 :
"Stereoselective synthesis of [alpha]-glycosyl azides byt TMSOTf-mediated ring opening of 1,6-anhydrosugars" (en anglais)

Poster Communications:
* JCO (Journées de Chimie Organique), Paris, September 2013 :
1) "Stereoselective synthesis of [alpha]-glycosyl azides byt TMSOTf-mediated ring opening of 1,6-anhydrosugars"
2) "Synthesis of cyclopeptoid-based iminosugar click clusters"

company.name: PECOHUE - Programa de Emprendimientos en Compost y Huerta

volunteer_experiences.description:
PECOHUE is a program in Buenos Aires (Argentina) that helps socially and mentally disabled youth (16-21 years old) to develop their relation to work and integrate society. One of the two sites is a small organic farm that produces and sells vegetables and compost on local markets. The youth are involved in the daily tasks of farming, and as well in the sale of the goods. Volunteers (internationals, health professionals, life assistants) are helping to make the program sustainable and to lead the personal development of youth.
Personnally, I gave a hand for two months in preparing the ground and building new allotments, which allowed to double the capacity of production.

French-German summer camp for children from 11 to 17 years old.
